diagrams.title: Register a Dog

threats.title: Spoofed Phishing Email
threats.description: A Malicious Actor could create an email with a fake invoice that the user would then send money to instead of the council.
threats.mitigation:
- The PDF containing the invoice could be instead accessed through the register web service (behind authentication)
- The payment could be handled on site rather than through an emailed invoice
- Users could be trained to identify phishing emails (Teach them to only read expected emails)

threats.title: Denial of Tag Receival
threats.description: The Dog Owner could deny receiving the tag from the council and force a refund
threats.mitigation:
- Council could photograph delivery
- Council could require a signature on delivery
- Internal logs for delivery

threats.title: Weak Database Password
threats.description: A malicious actor with access to the database could read / write to the database via a brute force attack on the password
threats.mitigation:
- Given the nature of the infrastructure, the database could accept only inbound connections from the machines hosting the dog registration processes
- Alongside this, use a strong password on database connection
- Don't expose the database address / port outside of the trusted network

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Endpoint Denial of Service
threats.description: A Malicious actor could exhaust system resources by thrashing the register endpoint with requests. Each of these requests block up the system providing a denial of service for other consumers
threats.mitigation:
- By observing excess usage of the register endpoint, the system could block / throttle requests from a given IP address
- Restrict each email to a single register request and have follow up requests for registering dogs, after a confirmation of email

threats.title: Adversary in the middle
threats.description: A malicious user could read inbound requests to the server to identify names and locations of users / dog owners
threats.mitigation: Encrypt all requests across public networks with HTTPS

threats.title: Data Manipulation: Transmitted Data Manipulation
threats.description: During transit, the email could be altered by a malicious actor to change the banking details that the user will submit the money to
threats.mitigation: Data in transit should be encrypted using a protocol such as HTTPS

threats.title: Adversary in the middle
threats.description: A malicious actor could install hardware on the council network to monitor requests between the registration process and the database.  This data could then be forwarded outside of the network via HTTPS / Bluetooth or other process
threats.mitigation:
- Encryption between processes on a network (even if the network is mostly trusted)
- Network monitoring and logging (Awareness of unexpected outbound requests)

data.name: Confirmation data
data.description:
Includes:
unique registration num.
and expr. date

threats.title: Impersonation of bank account
threats.description: A malicious user could impersonate the banking service and send false acknowledgement of payment to the councils registration process
threats.mitigation: Message passing between the bank account and the councils processes should be handled over an encrypted connection with a signed certificate to authenticate the request as originating from the bank acc

diagrams.description: 1.1.1 Owners can register their dogs on the councils web application

diagrams.title: Renew a Registration

data.name: Confirmation data
data.description:
Includes:
unique registration num.
and expr. date

diagrams.description: 1.1.2 Given the registration of their dog is about to end, owners can renew their registration

diagrams.title: Terminate a Registration

threats.title: Credentials spoofed / stolen
threats.description: Credentials can be stolen or made up
threats.mitigation:
Enforce password rules.
Use 2 factor authentication.
Encrypt passwords

threats.title: Repudiation of termination
threats.description: A user could terminate another users dog.
threats.mitigation: Log session details including ID of client to ensure traceability.

threats.title: Database unauthorized access
threats.description: A non authorized user has access to the contents of the DB.
threats.mitigation:
the DB uses credential that are stored securely.
Use the least privilege principle.

threats.title: Deny terminating dog
threats.description: End user claims to not have terminated a dog
threats.mitigation: Log requests and where they came from

threats.title: Unvalidated user terminates
threats.description: An unvalidated user terminates a dog when they do not have permission to do so.

data.name: User and dog details
data.description: Users email address, the dog tag ID, and the dog’s name

threats.title: Listening to connection
threats.description: An adversary in the middle can listen to the request and log the user and dog data.
threats.mitigation: Use transport layer security for communication.

threats.title: Termination service DDOS
threats.description: A malicious actor could mass send requests to the endpoint overloading it and slowing it down for all other users.
threats.mitigation: Monitor requests and block repeat requests coming from one IP address.

threats.title: Tampering with data
threats.description: By tampering with the data being sent to the DB a user could manipulate the database in unintended ways.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt the data being sent to the database to make it harder to tamper with

data.name: Confirmation email
data.description:
Email confirmation that the dog is not registered anymore, and that the tag can be destroyed.
Also contains a link to the registration process on the Council’s application in case the dog’s registration was terminated by mistake

threats.title: Send invalid link
threats.description: By tampering with the email a malicious actor could change the link to the registration process to a malicious link that infects the user.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

diagrams.description: 1.1.3 Given the dog has died or changed owner, their owner can terminate the dogs registration
